ah cool! i didn't know that worked like that
that's not really a bug, dude (and he's not connecting to localhost...)
sorry wasn't really following convo ... and connecting to localhost running vncserver works properly, so shouldn't vino also?
'properly'? :)
non-spastically :)
vino exports the current session, you can't connect to the current session on the current session and expect it to do something 'non-spastic' ;)
report a sane error that you souldn't eb doing that
similarly if you connect to a remote host and subsequently connect to the current session... ;)
for localhost, that's doable
although you can't tell which user's session you're connecting to
can't because it hasn't been implemented in gnome-session or can't because it's not technically practical?
the user's vino server would have to expose the username
hmm. ok well i need to look at the vino details a bit more
halting problem?
oh. heh, totally missed it in context.
